result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Marie Shutterly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.
Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $15,467.91 payable to Kmart located at 6077 South Packard Avenue, Cudahy, WI payable during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before any court costs, fees and assessments.

Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Kmart located at 6077 South Packard Avenue, South Milwaukee.

timeConds.notes: With Huber release privileges for work and child care; no more than 5 days a week.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 9-8-2015  at 12:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela Marie Shutterly

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order denying additional release privileges signed and filed.  Copy sent to defendant and state.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant seeking additional release privileges for child care.

Defendant Angela Marie Shutterly in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Restitution set at $15,467.91 payable to Kmart located at 6077  South Packard Avenue, Cudahy, WI payable during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before any court costs, fees and assessments. 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Kmart located at 6077 South Packard Avenue, South Milwaukee
-Perform 100 hours of community service
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 90 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work and child care; no more than 5 days a week.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 9-8-2015  at 12:00 p.m.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Angela Marie Shutterly in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angela Marie Shutterly in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduing conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angela Marie Shutterly in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Carmody for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
